fields.description:
I moved some repositories from the 'mg' user to the 'aragost' user and put in redirect. This mostly works, except that URLs like

https://bitbucket.org/mg/kick-start/src/

show the source page (with no content) instead of the redirection notice. If a repository had set the source page as the default page, then the redirect to the source page still takes place:

https://bitbucket.org/mg/remoteinfo/
fields.summary: Source page still exists for deleted repository (BB-1451)

fields.description: The drop down list for custom hostnames uses "/username/repository", however these links fail when you have a custom hostname, as it's adding the username to the url.
fields.summary: Repository links are incorrect for custom hostnames (BB-1438)
line numbers in multiple preformatted blocks always link to the first (BB-1436)
a table immediately following a preformatted block is partially obscured by the block (BB-1435)

fields.description:
Forbidden (403)

CSRF verification failed. Request aborted.
fields.summary: unable to signup with or without OpenID
Extra padding on support page (BB-1439)

fields.description:
I have setup a custom domain for my bitbucket repositories.\\
When I login to my custom domain, on the front page all links to the repositories are correct  in the form http://<domain>/<repo-name>/ .\\
But the links in "repositories" dropdown are incorrect and are in the form http://<domain>/<user>/<reponame> , which does not navigate to the valid repository with custom domain name.
fields.summary: the links to repositories in the toolbar when using custom domain name are incorrect

fields.description: For my project (simplerandom) I notice that when I click on the 'tags' menu item, the resulting drop-down is too narrow to show the full names of the tags. It's a bit inconvenient to not be able to read the names. I can't see a good reason why it should be so narrow.
fields.summary: Width of 'branches' and 'tags' drop-downs is too narrow (BB-1440)

fields.description:
C:\fakepath\GeckoFx-Linux-1.9.2-0.2.tar.gz

see:\\
https://bitbucket.org/geckofx/geckofx/downloads

Uploaded on Linux (Ubuntu) using Google Chrome.
fields.summary: When I upload from a file for download it now has c:\fakepath prepended to it.

fields.description:
An unknown bug happend to me.

By
fields.summary: TortiseHg Bug

fields.description:
IMHO, characters with accents (á, ã, â, ...)  should be converted to it's ASCII correspondent, not to hyphens. Like in Django's slugify filter.\\
For example, "Maçã" should be "maca". Currently it gets converted to "ma--".

It happens in projects slugs and issues slugs.

Thank you
fields.summary: Better slugs (BB-1429)

fields.description:
See:

https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg-winbuild/downloads

Just started happening in the last day or two.  It did not happen when I uploaded files to https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/stable/downloads.

I always upload to thg-winbuild with Chrome+Win7.  The machine that uploaded to stable was Firefox+Vista, if that matters..
fields.summary: Uploaded files are getting C:\fakepath\ prepended to them (BB-1432)

fields.description:
No priority property for issues.

Any plan to achieve this?

Thanks very much for hg hosting. :)
fields.summary: No priority property for issues

fields.description:
Every time I attempt to confirm my email address, using an email sent from bitbucket, it results in a 404 - Not Found - "The page you're looking for seems to be missing."

I cannot access the documentation for the source I downloaded until I can confirm my email address.

I've resent the email three times and tried the links from all emails with the same 404 results.
fields.summary: Can't confirm account email address

fields.description:
{{{\\
$ hg push\\
pushing to https://geckofx@bitbucket.org/geckofx/geckofx/wiki\\
searching for changes\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: geckofx\\
password:\\
remote: ssl required\\
}}}
fields.summary: Getting ssl required - when pushing to wiki (BB-1488)

fields.description: davecheney/hal-server does not exist, but whenever I try to create it, it 500's on me.
fields.summary: Cannot create repository hal-server
bitbucket's view of a commit is missing a file (BB-1430)

fields.description: BAH filed this in the wrong place. Can't delete it now. Sorry.
fields.summary: Don't select a tweet after it's been sent

fields.description:
I am trying to strip a branch from my repo (revision 814cb568ad66 from the repo corrin/book), but the web interface always times out. It has some large files it, so I tried just stripping one revision at a time, but it still times out. Is there a way around this? Or could an admin do it for me on the server?

Thanks in advance,\\
Emlyn
fields.summary: Website times out when stripping (BB-1431)

fields.description:
Greetings,

I'm using definition list in my README.rst, the definitions are not rendered correctly - as you can see at https://bitbucket.org/tebeka/fs/src (under the API section)

h2. Thanks,
Miki
fields.summary: ReStructuredText bug

fields.description: To help our project managers find their way around more easily it would be helpful if the landing page for a project could be set to the issue tracker; for them, the other pages are not very useful.
fields.summary: It should be possible to set "landing page" to issue tracker (BB-1404)

fields.description:
I added a mailinglist under "Email others:" in a project of ours, but no mails are being sent to that address when a new issue is created.

The project in question is casebuilders/learningcase
fields.summary: "Email others" notifications are not sent (BB-1405)

fields.description:
As I am unable to check out using svn. It shows following error

OPTIONS of 'http://bitbucket.org/azeem/mms/trunk': could not connect to server (http://bitbucket.org)
fields.summary: OPTIONS of 'http://bitbucket.org/azeem/mms/trunk': could not connect to server (http://bitbucket.org)

fields.description:
If an issue has a version assigned to it and then I change the version to 'nothing' (as shown in Screen1.png) the properties (bottom of Screen1.png) say that it has no version, but the version is still listed as its old version ('2010-Q4 Config' in Screen1.png).

The old version also shows up in the version column within the list of all issues (Screen2.png).

If I sort to show all of the issues with a version of '2010-Q4 Config', these mis-labeled issues are not returned (this is proper behavior). With sorting, the end of the repository URL has "issues?version=2010-Q4 Config" and only returns the correct results.
fields.summary: Changing "Version" to None keeps the old version information.

fields.description: For my private repos the overview is reporting Bryan Veloso and Anonymous as the committers on projects only I have committed. From this I can no longer commit as it says that my projects are out of sync
fields.summary: Wrong committers

fields.description:
When I get a pull request in bitbucket, I find it quite cumbersome to have to go to my local repo, pull the data and push it to bitbucket.

Instead I’d like to be able to see the changes (as in 'hg in -p') and accept the request directly or only up to a certain revision.

Issue 1799 (pull requests as issues) would also be nice here, especially if followup pull requests could be connected.

Maybe just a button: "connect the pull request with issue <select> or create new issue for pull request".

Best wishes,\\
Arne
fields.summary: wish: pull directly in bitbucket web-ui (BB-1396)

fields.description: The djangopackages.com site currently only lists a single user as the owner of a repository because bitbucket's API doesn't seem to provide access to the admins/writers of a repo. Could you please extend the API with the full listing of users who have write access to the repo? Thanks!
fields.summary: API: Provide access to repo admins/writers/readers (BB-1406)

fields.summary: Paragraph splitting in Forks is at the wrong place

fields.description:
Hello!\\
It would very useful to have an easy way to report a bug in someone's project!\\
Looking at bitbucket's web interface, I don't see any direct way of doing that!\\
Best regards!
fields.summary: Simple request: do a bug report on a project!

fields.description:
Hi there,

When trying to create a definition list on a wiki page, the results do not render correctly.  For example:

{{{\\
; Term\\
: Definition\\
}}}

renders as

{{{\\
Definition\\
}}}

"Term" does not show up.  It seems to just be a CSS issue since the HTML of the resulting page does include the <dt> and the <dd>.

Anyway, your help docs indicate that you support definition lists, but if they do not show up properly, then that's not really true.  It would be nice if they worked, though.

Thanks for the awesome site!

Krys
fields.summary: Definition lists in wiki do not render properly. (BB-1394)

fields.description: When editing the content field of an existing issue by clicking the edit link, an "Edit" button appears alongside with "Cancel". The "Edit" button actually saves the new content, so should be named "Save".
fields.summary: Content save button should be named "Save" not "Edit" (BB-1397)

fields.description: When editing an existing issue I click the pencil icon by the title to turn it into a text input area. However changes to the title are lost once I click away and there is no save button.
fields.summary: Cannot saved edited title in issue tracker

fields.description:
When editing the title of an already existing issue, pressing tab changes the field focus but does not save any changes made.

To actually change the title, enter/return must be pressed after making the changes. There is no graphical indication that this is what must be done.

I'm suggesting that pressing tab saves changes in addition to the return/enter keys.
fields.summary: Save the Issue summary on tab as well as enter (BB-1398)

fields.description:
... on this ungodly ugly, verbose, unreadable, and worthless "Documentation" page:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Using+your+Bitbucket+Repository

Way to wreck a great thing, guys.  We'll be looking for a new solution immediately.
fields.summary: Finally found it!

fields.description: I can't believe you've removed this feature.  This is a showstopper for us.  What have you been smoking?
fields.summary: change the clone link so that clicking it copies the link to your paste buffer (BB-1392)

fields.description:
Would be nice to have a filter, to for example, only get open, or resolved, or new issues.

Like:

{{{\\
(ApiUrl)/Issues/?status=new   -- Returns 'new' issues\\
(ApiUrl)/Issues/?status=open  -- Returns 'open' issues\\
}}}

Together with <<issue 1855>> would be better for all devs.
fields.summary: API: Filter on /Issues/ (BB-1391)

fields.description:
I am unable to log in to my bitbucket.com account via FireFox 3.6.15

No problem when using IE6 or Google Chrome 9.0.597.107

Forbidden (403)\\
CSRF verification failed. Request aborted.\\
You are seeing this message because this HTTPS site requires a 'Referer header' to be sent by your Web browser, but none was sent. This header is required for security reasons, to ensure that your browser is not being hijacked by third parties.\\
If you have configured your browser to disable 'Referer' headers, please re-enable them, at least for this site, or for HTTPS connections, or for 'same-origin' requests.\\
More information is available with DEBUG=True.
fields.summary: FireFox Preventing BitBucket.com Account Log On

fields.description: After selecting a file  to add as attachmend and clicking on the link "add attachment" I'm moved to the top of site instead of adding an attachment. Please fix it as soon as possible.
fields.summary: Attachment adding issue

* one
* two
* three

fields.summary: Wiki lists are left justified starting in a further left position than the normal surrounding text  (BB-1390)

fields.description:
Any time I try to associate my Google account OpenId with my BB account, I get a page that says: "Could not verify OpenID."

When I look at my authorized sites on Google though, it shows BB as authorized.

Wish I had more information, but the error was to short for me to be able to gather much info.
fields.summary: Could not verify OpenID.

fields.description: See the screenshot for the issue with the permission selection and the group name overlapping eachother.
fields.summary: Group permissions layout issue

fields.description: See the screenshot for the issue with the permission selection and the group name overlapping eachother.
fields.summary: Group permissions layout issue (BB-1387)

fields.description: It looks like the download source-button in repository view is not displayed correctly. It wraps to a new line, which makes it hardly visible. Screenshot is attached.
fields.summary: Download source-button wraps to next line

fields.description:
A "Help Wanted" feature would be pretty neat. You could even go a bit more in depth than a simple flag that is searchable or filterable by, and include a way to write up specific needs for the project which people can search by.

I think this could be a cool way to help people find open source projects to contribute to.
fields.summary: Include a way for a project to list a 'Help Wanted' (BB-1368)

fields.description:
When I try to get the issue's comments, i receive the following error:

{{{Piston/0.2.3rc1 (Django 1.2.5) crash report: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2010-09-28/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django_piston-0.2.3rc1-py2.7.egg/piston/handler.py", line 84, in read pkfield = self.model._meta.pk.name AttributeError: 'IssueCommentHandler' object has no attribute 'model'}}}
fields.summary: API: /issues/(ID)/comments results in an internal server exception (BB-1369)

fields.description: My newsfeed shows Adrian Sampson (a different user, not a member of my project) as the committer, but it is a commit that I performed on a private repository for which I am the only member currently.
fields.summary: Newsfeed user issue

fields.description:
Currently the regular interface provides username autocompletion / suggestions via jQuery's autocomplete widget, backed by requests to http://bitbucket.org/xhr/users/?term=part_of_a_username

Considering that the API allows you to grant privileges to users it would be nice to have some kind of API endpoint that offers the same functionality as mentionned above. Without it, one has to go back and forth between bitbucket and the client application to verify and/or copy usernames. Not a big issue when it's a limited amount of people, but it does decrease the usability of the privileges-endpoint.

The same thing would probably be usefull for groups as well.
fields.summary: Username suggestions via API

fields.description:
When i'm try to create new issue at issues tracker of my projects, i can't change issue type. Combobox "Type" didn't popup. The only way to change issue type is to change default issue type before create new issue.\\
If it would help, i'm using Chrome and Opera browsers
fields.summary: Can't change new issue type (BB-1359)

fields.description: My account is displaying as an anonymous user in the newsfeed. The hg user did not change, and I have the appropriate alias set. I have attached a screenshot.
fields.summary: Anonymous user in Newsfeed (BB-1362)

fields.description: A lot of times, when I follow a user, I'm only interested in new projects they create or fork, and not every single commit they make. It would be nice to be able to control the amount of detail that goes into the feed.
fields.summary: Offer a less noisy follow user option (BB-923)

fields.description: I have had a couple times where I have a created a repository but forgot to make it private only to figure that out a couple weeks later.  It would be nice if I could set an option in my account to "create repositories private by default".  I would rather create a public repository private by accident than the reverse.
fields.summary: Add option to set repositories private by default

fields.description:
I click on the Issues->Create new issue button, and it allows me to create a new issue.

In the "Properties" pane on the right, it allows me to assign the bug to one of the (two) developers, or nobody.

There are "Type" and "Component" drop-downs there too. However, clicking on them does not open the drop-down, and I cannot change the selection (from "Bug" and "------").

Expected behaviour: I can open the drop-downs and change the Type to e.g. "enhancement", or change the component.

Also, if I just go ahead and create the issue with the (unwanted) default selections for those two fields, I can't then change them. i.e. you can't edit the component or type once the issue is created.

I'm using Firefox 3.6.14 on Ubuntu.
fields.summary: Creating new issue does not allow setting component, issue type (BB-1363)

fields.description: I wanted to change my username, but I found out that I had a previous account that I must have forgotten about laying around unused with that same name. I logged into the old one and changed it to something else, and then changed my primary account to the same name. Now, if I look at my activity feed, it is showing the one action I ever took with the old account, and nothing that I previously did with my current one.
fields.summary: Switching username loses history. (BB-1082)

fields.description:
I noticed that on my repositories page (https://bitbucket.org/repo/mine), my repos show an incorrect number of followers. You can see a screenshot attached (private repo removed).

I just changed my username, I don't know if that has anything to do with it.
fields.summary: Incorrect Followers (BB-639)

fields.description:
I cannot hg clone from bitbucket from NetBSD-5.99.47/amd64.\\
NetBSD contains a rather recent openssl snapshot, and another user informed me of the following:

=== begin quote ===\\
I started seeing the same error after bitbucket made HTTPS mandatory in December.

I don't know what SSL implementation bitbucket is using, but as far as I can tell it's sending garbage in response to TLSv1.1 requests.\\
They probably haven't noticed because the problem won't affect anyone using older (pre-TLSv1.1) versions of OpenSSL on the client side, but it shows up with either the OpenSSL in -current or with more recent OpenSSL snapshots.

I think bitbucket needs to fix the problem on the server side, but\\
in the meantime I've worked around it by patching Python's ssl module to restrict Python and hg to TLSv1.0 or earlier. With the patch below, everything works fine for me.

Equivalently (more or less), I expect that your command-line test will work if you add the -tls1 option, viz.:\\
openssl s_client -tls1 -connect bitbucket.org:443

The -debug option to s_client is also useful for seeing how the\\
server's responses differ with and without -tls1.

{code}
                                                                                                   
{code}

diff python/Modules/_ssl.c python/Modules/_ssl.c\\
--- python/Modules/_ssl.c\\
+++ python/Modules/_ssl.c\\
@@ -365,7 +365,7 @@ newPySSLObject(PySocketSockObject *Sock, char *key_file, char *cert_file,\\
}

{code}
                                                                                                                                
 /* ssl compatibility */                                                                                                        
{code}

* SSL_CTX_set_options(self->ctx, SSL_OP_ALL);

* SSL_CTX_set_options(self->ctx, SSL_OP_ALL|SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_1);

{code}
                                                                                                                           
{code}

verification_mode = SSL_VERIFY_NONE;\\
if (certreq == PY_SSL_CERT_OPTIONAL)\\
=== end quote ===

(The patch won't apply since it will have whitespace issues from cut'n'paste.)\\
I have tried connecting with -tls1 and it does indeed fix the problem.

For comparison:

h1. openssl s_client  -connect bitbucket.org:443
h2. CONNECTED(00000006)\\
140187580655852:error:140770FC:SSL routines:SSL23_GET_SERVER_HELLO:unknown protocol:/archive/cvs/src/crypto/external/bsd/openssl/dist/ssl/s23_clnt.c:705:
h2. no peer certificate available
h2. No client certificate CA names sent
h2. SSL handshake has read 7 bytes and written 145 bytes
h2. New, (NONE), Cipher is (NONE)\\
Secure Renegotiation IS NOT supported\\
Compression: NONE\\
Expansion: NONE
h2. openssl s_client  -tls1 -connect bitbucket.org:443\\
CONNECTED(00000006)\\
depth=0 C = NL, O = bitbucket.org, OU = GT16385137, OU = See www.geotrust.com/resources/cps (c)09, OU = Domain Control Validated - QuickSSL(R), CN = bitbucket.org\\
verify error:num=20:unable to get local issuer certificate\\
verify return:1\\
depth=0 C = NL, O = bitbucket.org, OU = GT16385137, OU = See www.geotrust.com/resources/cps (c)09, OU = Domain Control Validated - QuickSSL(R), CN = bitbucket.org\\
verify error:num=27:certificate not trusted\\
verify return:1\\
depth=0 C = NL, O = bitbucket.org, OU = GT16385137, OU = See www.geotrust.com/resources/cps (c)09, OU = Domain Control Validated - QuickSSL(R), CN = bitbucket.org\\
verify error:num=21:unable to verify the first certificate\\
verify return:1
h2. Certificate chain\\
0 s:/C=NL/O=bitbucket.org/OU=GT16385137/OU=See www.geotrust.com/resources/cps (c)09/OU=Domain Control Validated - QuickSSL(R)/CN=bitbucket.org\\
i:/C=US/O=Equifax/OU=Equifax Secure Certificate Authority
h2. Server certificate\\
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\\
MIIDLDCCApWgAwIBAgIDDZCWMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAME4xCzAJBgNVBAYTAlVT\\
MRAwDgYDVQQKEwdFcXVpZmF4MS0wKwYDVQQLEyRFcXVpZmF4IFNlY3VyZSBDZXJ0\\

fields.description:
I can list repositories over the API (including private ones) just fine, but I've been trying to use it to create repositories with no luck.

I've tried following the docs, but it never seems to work. For example this:

curl -uuser:password -X POST -d "name=testapicreate"  https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/

.. just dumps a stack trace:\\
{{{\\
#!python

Piston/0.2.3rc1 (Django 1.2.5) crash report:

Traceback (most recent call last):

File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2010-09-28/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django_piston-0.2.3rc1-py2.7.egg/piston/utils.py", line 91, in wrap\\
if form.is_valid():

File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2010-09-28/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/forms/forms.py", line 121, in is_valid\\
return self.is_bound and not bool(self.errors)

File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2010-09-28/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/forms/forms.py", line 112, in _get_errors\\
self.full_clean()

File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2010-09-28/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/forms/forms.py", line 267, in full_clean\\
self._clean_fields()

File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2010-09-28/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/forms/forms.py", line 287, in _clean_fields\\
value = getattr(self, 'clean_%s' % name)()

File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2010-09-28/bitbucket/../bitbucket/apps/bb/forms.py", line 44, in clean_name\\
if Repository.objects.filter(owner=self.user,

AttributeError: 'RepositoryForm' object has no attribute 'user'\\
}}}

Assistance would be welcome.
fields.summary: API: can't seem to create repositories (BB-1356)

fields.description:
For example:

https://bitbucket.org/ianb/pip/pull

Users "carljm" and "jezdez" appear twice.

fields.description:
The new compare feature is awesome but I have found that I can view a list of changes in private forks of my repository that I do not have access to.

I.e.  I have admin rights in main repo. I do not have access to forked repo but I can get a perfect list of what has been changed in it by running the compare feature!
fields.summary: Private forks in compare feature (BB-1355)

fields.description:
I tried to create a patch queue four days ago for repository https://bitbucket.org/jmb/nimrod-mirror/overview and it is still not created. When I go to the page for the patch queue, I get a message stating that it is being created and that if it takes too long, I should go to the admin page, delete it and retry. Unfortunately, when I try to go to the admin page I get another error message stating simply that an error occurred.

I tried to re-create another patch queue anyway in case it was a one time error, but the second one is in the same state.

The relevant patch queues are: https://bitbucket.org/jmb/nimrod-jmb and https://bitbucket.org/jmb/nimrod-patches
fields.summary: Creating patch queue did not complete after more than four days.

fields.description:
When browsing source with long line, horizontal scrolling to the right makes the line number move and disappear.

This is decreasing the usability of\\
source browsing UI. Line numbers should be fixed whether user side scrolling to the left or to the right.
fields.summary: Horizontal scrolling makes line number move also (BB-1347)

fields.description:
i work in hangzhou, & i can no longer access bitbucket.org (http/https/\\
ssh) for my hg projects.

github.com works fine tho.
fields.summary: bitbucket.org blocked in china

fields.description:
We are getting the following warning message:

"Your private repositories are over their user limit. Committers have read only access. Resolve this."

The "Plans and Billing" box clearly shows 3/5 private users. What's going on?
fields.summary: Got a "Your private repositories are over their user limit" message, but have only 3/5 users. (BB-1281)

fields.description: Cannot click on the footer links.  No hover actions or cursor changing to "pointer" occurs.
fields.summary: cannot click on footer links in chrome 9.0.578.79

fields.description:
Repo: axyonych/sentierivivi

After striping out some revision I can't push into repository anymore.

Looks like I run into the same issue like <<issue 2368>>.

Can you recover my repository?
fields.summary: remote: abort: abandoned transaction found - run hg recover

fields.description:
On https://bitbucket.org/pfein/twiggy/ , I created a bunch of bugs with version 0.5.0, then decided that I wanted a null version for them. I deleted the version in the issues Admin, and updated all the bugs.

Despite messages indicated the version had been deleted: https://bitbucket.org/pfein/twiggy/issue/4/follow-pep8#comment-387287 , the bug still shows version 0.5.0 both in it's summary and the queries.
fields.summary: Can't set Version to nothing (BB-1333)

fields.description:
Hello!

When I use Bitbucket REST API to retrieve the list of branches in xml format:

https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/atlassian/connector-idea/branches/?format=xml

I've got (in firefox, or in SAXReader):\\
{{{\\
#!text\\
XML Parsing Error: not well-formed\\
Location: https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/atlassian/connector-idea/branches/?format=xml\\
Line Number 2, Column 7114:\\
}}}\\
and indeed, on the column 7114 above repository has branch named "2.4.2-FULL"\\
{{{\\
#!xml\\
(...)\\
<raw_node>6cd94950154e96607eaa29de2bacc4b1fdc5fdbb</raw_node>\\
<parents>\\
<resource>727303d86b73</resource>\\
</parents>\\
<branch>ACC-16</branch>\\
<message>ACC-16: removed ValueNotYetInitilized exception.</message>\\
<revision>3745</revision>\\
<size>7624</size>\\
</ACC-16>\\
<2.4.2-FULL>    <!-- HERE, this is column 7114 -->\\
<node>eccefaade98f</node>\\
<files>\\
<resource>\\
<type>modified</type>\\
(...)\\
}}}

The branch name starts with a number character and I assume it can't be used as valid xml element name. (http://www.w3schools.com/XML/xml_elements.asp)

Is this a bug in Bitbucket REST API?
fields.summary: REST API doesn't return well-formed xml (BB-1316)

fields.description:
Hey guys, when logged into my account and browsing Bitbucket, the links in the footer are non-functional for me. Using Ubuntu 10.10 + Google Chrome.

Example links: API, Server Status, Terms of Service, Privacy, etc.

Even on this page (for reporting issues), the footer links don't function.

Cheers
fields.summary: Non-functional links in footer

fields.description:
Hello. In order not to violate the license of my software, I do not allow public forking of my repository, because the forks must not use the name of the original software in their name.

The situation is the following:

* I create a public repo, but not allow public forks.
* Someone creates a private fork and makes changes
* He then places a pull request in my repo.

The problem is that it would not let me pull the changeset. The only place where I could find the changeset was in the /descendants section of my repo. Then again it was only available in HTML form as displayed by the browser. No possibility to download the diff in plain text format or pull it in my repo on bitbucket.

I either do it wrong or something is not implemented correctly there.

Thanks for your time.
fields.summary: Could not pull from private repo

fields.description:
My recent activity at https://bitbucket.org/danderson shows that 6 weeks ago, I committed https://bitbucket.org/sqs/account-central/changeset/4e4a8e60aa47 . The only problem is... I didn't. I've never even heard of the project in question.

Looks like Bitbucket decided that the commit had to be from me, because it's from username "danderson". Smells like a repository that is being mirrored from somewhere else with that username in the history.
fields.summary: Bitbucket attributes to me a commit I never made (BB-1305)
xml syntax highlighting not working in Issue Tracker's preview (BB-1317)

fields.description:
When I ask for stripping on filmow/r0, it gives me an error message

Please strip for me if needed. Thank you
fields.summary: Push to Large Kicks the Bucket when stripping

fields.description: The content div's bottom padding of 180px is occluding the footer, so none of the links can be clicked on.  I solved this in Chrome and Firefox by adding *position: relative;* to *#footer*
fields.summary: Footer links on Bitbucket aren't clickable

fields.description: While displaying a basic content, I get following error: "Fatal error: ob_start() [ref.outcontrol]: Cannot use output buffering in output buffering display handlers in system/core/Exceptions.php on line 166"
fields.summary: Fatal output error (see details)

fields.description:
My newsfeed is showing me a few stray commits to a project that doesn't exist.

[see attachment]

The project link points to the BitBucket homepage, and the individual commits point to #nrm. At first I thought it was leaking a private repo, but neither user knows what repository that is.

Some more sleuthing reveals that these revision numbers/commit messages match actual commits to CodeIgniter from *3 years ago*.

A colleague (<<user gaker>>) confirms seeing the same set of odd commits.
fields.summary: Newsfeed showing random / old commits (BB-1318)

fields.description:
This text is not clickable:\\
Atlassian | Terms of Service | Privacy | Report a Bug | API | Server Status\\
on:\\
https://bitbucket.org/plans and a lot of other pages too it seems.
fields.summary: Text not linked (BB-1308)

fields.description:
From the issue at: http://hg.brysons.me/software_dev/issue/2/new-build-system-wont-work-on-my-macbook#comment-383607\\
I have "<<changeset 50>>" in the the text of comment BCLOUD-4.

The link generated by "<<changeset 50>>" expands to: http://hg.brysons.me/*brysons*/software_dev/changeset/ef1c4d2dd589  which is broken.\\
It should expand to: http://hg.brysons.me/software_dev/changeset/ef1c4d2dd589  which works correctly.
fields.summary: "Link to Issue" doesn't work with "Use Your Own Domain" (BB-558)

fields.description: Screenshot of the problem is attached.
fields.summary: Issue table breaking out of layout (Safari 5, OS X 10.6)

fields.description:
The json data returned for a specific issue or for a list of issues does not indicate the status of the issue (e.g., new/open/closed).

As far as I know, there is no way to determine the status of an issue through the REST API. Something like that would be useful:

{{{\\
#!bash

curl https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/qualyzer/main/issues/63/\\
{\\
...\\
"created_on": "2010-08-06 16:48:54",\\
"local_id": 63,\\
"follower_count": 1,\\
"metadata": {\\
"kind": "enhancement",\\
"version": "0.1",\\
"component": "Core",\\
"milestone": "1.0",\\
"status": "resolved",\\
},\\
...\\
}}}
fields.summary: REST API - Add status to issues metadata

fields.description:
It seems that patches with deleted files break. I made this repository to illustrate the problem: https://bitbucket.org/robsimmons/mqtest-patch/qseries

{{{\\
bash-3.2$ hg qclone https://bitbucket.org/robsimmons/mqtest-patch\\
no changes found\\
requesting all changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 1 changesets with 2 changes to 2 files\\
updating to branch default\\
2 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved\\
0 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved\\
bash-3.2$ cd mqtest-patch/\\
bash-3.2$ hg qnew patch.add\\
bash-3.2$ cat > TEST\\
test\\
bash-3.2$ hg add TEST\\
bash-3.2$ hg qrefresh\\
bash-3.2$ hg qnew patch.del\\
bash-3.2$ hg rm TEST\\
bash-3.2$ hg qrefresh\\
bash-3.2$ hg qcommit -m "Add, then delete, TEST"\\
bash-3.2$ cd .hg/patches/\\
bash-3.2$ hg push\\
pushing to https://bitbucket.org/robsimmons/mqtest-patch/.hg/patches\\
searching for changes\\
remote: adding changesets\\
remote: adding manifests\\
remote: adding file changes\\
remote: added 1 changesets with 3 changes to 3 files\\
remote: bb/acl: robsimmons is allowed. accepted payload.\\
bash-3.2$\\
}}}

I can view the first patch here: https://bitbucket.org/robsimmons/mqtest-patch/qseries?apply=t&qs_apply=patch.add, but the second patch can't be viewed because it includes a deleted file (I conjecture): https://bitbucket.org/robsimmons/mqtest-patch/qseries?apply=t&qs_apply=patch.del
fields.summary: patches that delete can't be seen in patch queue (BB-1309)

fields.description: Requesting that Standard ML, very much like OCaml, syntax highlighting be added.
fields.summary: Add Standard ML/SML syntax highlighting

fields.description:
I am selecting download and picking the zip extension.  I am using IE / Chrome and have the same problem.  The file downloads however when I try to open i get error message that the {filename}.zip is invalid

How do avoid this?\\
thx
fields.summary: windows cannot open folder zip downloads invalid

fields.description:
Similiar to cia.vc for commit messages I would prefer to get informed about a new issue on the tracker by sending the title and a link to our irc channel.

Because almost all of our communication is irc based I would prefer to get messages about new issues shown there.
fields.summary: issue tracker should send new issues as message to irc

fields.description:
The web form for creating a new custom username alias won't allow a custom user name of the form:\\
'FirstName LastName [email%40example.com]' - without the quotes.\\
To my understanding a validation error occurs, having no description.
fields.summary: Custom username alias (BB-1301)

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a download archive for every branch. That would make it easier for people (n00bs) to check the development without accessing the repo (and thus for managing projects with people who are not computer savvy at all).

I could just say „download the 2.4 branch to get the data“.
fields.summary: Downloads for all branches (not only tip + tags) (BB-1303)

fields.description:
When I push commits to the bitbucket, they are shown with different authors on different pages.

For example, on newsfeed on my dashboard I am recognized (screenshot: http://cl.ly/0A3q1p2y420z43101F2J), in my profile I am recognized too, but with other nickname (http://cl.ly/3f0B3P301n1g2q3C2u3d) and in project overview I am not recognized (http://cl.ly/3S0l2P1v3g2x3O273g2q).
fields.summary: Problem with commits author. (BB-1305)
PHP syntax highlighting in wiki not working

fields.description:
Hello,\\
It would be interesting if in the "Source" tab of a repository the content of a different file from README could be seen. This is important for a projects in other language than English or for an important information in other file no named README. The name of the file to show the content could be configured via the "Admnin" tab.

Thanks
fields.summary: README file in "Source" tab

fields.description:
I recently did a commit with the username jon (I am named jon).  This doesn't match with my bitbucket username and it apparently matched another bitbucket user (Jonathan Beavers).  Imagine my surprise when I look on my dashboard and some random dude named Jonathan Beavers has committed to my private repository!

This could be construed as user-error.

P.S. I love bitbucket!
fields.summary: user on committed could be tied to incorrect user (BB-1305)

fields.description:
I think it would be really great to be able to release application using ClickOnce.

(Something like they implemented it in http://codeplex.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=ClickOnce )
fields.summary: ClickOnce release support (BB-1277)

fields.description:
You should put a link to the documentation of BitBucket services in the Admin page to activate them.

e.g. in this page:

* https://bitbucket.org/dalloliogm/fake-qsub/admin/services

put a link to this documentation:\\
*\\
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Managing+Bitbucket+Services
fields.summary: missing documentation in the Services page (BB-1278)

fields.description:
==== Current ====

* Fork userA/repo to userB/repo
* (hack, hack; pull request; merge changes in userA's repo)
* delete userB/repo
* check userB's newsfeed, it will display:

*forked //unknown// as repo*

Originating repository has since been deleted.

(//unknown// and //repo// are both links to the homepage http://bitbucket.org )

==== Expected ====\\
Since userA/repo is still here, you can link to the source repo. I understand that the target is gone, and //unknown// is good enough, but somehow the logic is wrong, as the originating repository is still here: only the destination repository is gone.

Thanks guys :)
fields.summary: "forked a repo" Newsfeed displays wrong links if target repo has been deleted since then (BB-1279)

fields.description:
==== Current behavior ====

* not logged in
* click "fork" on a repo page
* -> redirected to login page
* I log in
* -> redirected to home page
* (?? where is my fork)

==== Expected ====\\
After logging in, I would like to be redirected to the fork dialog.

==== Related bug ====\\
This is a corollary of https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/2384/login-should-return-to-original-page-bb , except that BCLOUD-2384 is marked as an enhancement. This one is definitely a bug.

Thanks guys :~)
fields.summary: Trying to fork a repo when not logged-in forgets your request on the way (BB-1280)

fields.description: When I go to my dashboard, the commits that are shown are all marked as from 'Anonymous'.  The Avatar that is shown is not what I have set in my configuration. The image link on the Avatar points to https://bitbucket.org/Francois-Denis%20Gonthier which doesn't exist. It should be https://bitbucket.org/fdgonthier instead.
fields.summary: Own commits show as 'Anonymous' in my dashboard

fields.description: I'm using Firefox v3.6.13, and I am unable to upload any downloadable files consistently. In order to make uploading work, I have to try to upload the file several times in a row, by repeatedly clicking "upload" and then "Continue" when the security warning pops up. And this results in a file who's name is repeated based on the number of upload/Continue cycles I needed to press before it actually started uploading.
fields.summary: Cannot upload files consistently. (BB-1276)
